meanings.sent1: After the ice cream melted, we had to refreeze it in the freezer.
meanings.sent2: If you leave the water outside in the cold, it will refreeze into ice.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my popsicle out too long, so I had to refreeze it before it turned into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The lake was so cold that even the slightest movement caused the water to refreeze instantly.
meanings.sent5: The snowman started to melt in the sun, but the children quickly refroze it with more snow.

meanings.sent1: The ice on the road began to refreeze as the temperature dropped below zero.
meanings.sent2: If you take the ice cream out of the freezer, it will refreeze if you put it back in.
meanings.sent3: The river was starting to thaw, but then a sudden cold snap caused it to refreeze completely.
meanings.sent4: Her heart had begun to thaw towards him, but his cold words made it refreeze once more.
meanings.sent5: The snow on the branches had started to melt, but the frost at night caused it to refreeze into a sparkling coat.
